text:
I'd like to talk about the philosopher Alex Dupont. He was one of the biggest thinker over time.
One of his theories is called "The unsocial sociability". Alex Dupont thinks that humans are made to make groups. But at the same time, they can't be equal, they'll always try to be better than others.
"Humans can't lives without each others but they can't stand each others".
For the philosopher, those pulsions are natural and are not wanted.
So humans needs each others to live but they wants to be better than their fellows.  This unsocial sociability is sometimes bad for the group because someone could have the idea of dominating the group, be the leader so they have to create a state.
Alex Dupont said that every humans are double being, with two sides, one who is sociable and wants to take part of the health group. And an other one who needs to get always more than others to feel good.
 I wanted to talk about this because in my opinion, it illustrate perfectly the society today. Nobody is happy with what he currently has.
I can't stand with people that wants always more, I like helping people and create links with them. But a lot of them are self-centred and just wants they own happiness. I understand this but, I can't understand when big industries destroys the wilderness, the home of a lot of human being just to make money for their hapiness.
It's an example but their a lot more. That's why I decided to go in education's studies. I'd like to help people, to explain them that when you give something to someone, you create a wave of love that will always comeback to you one day.
